Html:
Hi,

I have a question regarding the two dlls offered: One for Windows Forms and one for WPF (Presentation). Is there any reason why this decision has been made? Can't the elements like GmapControl, GmapMarker, the events, etc. used in both projects? I mean, if I would like to write a dll that allows both applications to use it, how should it be done? I always need to define if I use the Forms or WPF dll. Thanks for any help.

greetings,
gustavson
dunno, old stuff... but you can put it in one dll if you want

okay, thanks for your answer...but after looking at both dll's I am a little confused how to do that.
Let's see for example the classes:
The WPF dll lacks of an GMAPOverlay, a GMapToolTip, the ObservableCollection, et cetera, et cetera...
And if look into the GmapControl, i.e., it is completely different from each other.
So, I would really like to ask how I could start with building one of two? I don't have much experience with this,
so any help is kindly appreciated.

thanks,
gustavson

okay, I see..well, then I will have to use both..thanks anyway..

bye
